member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.returns: A reference to a backup endpoints element.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies a reference to a client endpoint that sends messages if the associated message filter matches the message.
member.returns: A key to a client endpoint.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Routing.Configuration.FilterTableEntryElement.FilterName
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies a reference to the filter element.
member.returns: A key to the filter element.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Routing.Configuration.FilterTableEntryElement.Priority
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the priority of this entry.
member.returns: The priority of this entry. The default value is 0.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.Routing.Configuration.FilterType
member.summary: Specifies the type of filter to use when routing messages.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Routing.Configuration.FilterType.Action
member.summary: Use to filter on an action.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Routing.Configuration.FilterType.EndpointAddress
member.summary: Use with set to false to filter on the address.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Routing.Configuration.FilterType.PrefixEndpointAddress
member.summary: Use with set to false to filter on the address using longest prefix matching.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Routing.Configuration.FilterType.And
member.summary: Use to filter on two message filters, ANDed together.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Routing.Configuration.FilterType.Custom
member.summary: Use a user-defined filter.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Routing.Configuration.FilterType.EndpointName
member.summary: Use the to filter on the name of the service endpoint.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Routing.Configuration.FilterType.MatchAll
member.summary: Use the to match all messages.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Routing.Configuration.FilterType.XPath
member.summary: Use the to filter on an XPath expression.

member.summary: Represents a configuration element that contains sub-elements that specify the routing behavior.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of class.

member.summary: Gets the type of behavior.
member.returns: The behavior type.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Routing.Configuration.RoutingExtensionElement.EnsureOrderedDispatch
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether messages are to be dispatched in the order they were sent.
member.returns: true if messages are to be dispatched in the order they were sent; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Routing.Configuration.RoutingExtensionElement.FilterTableName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the filter table used by this routing service for routing messages.
member.returns: The name of the filter table.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Routing.Configuration.RoutingExtensionElement.RouteOnHeadersOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the filter is allowed to access only the message headers or the message headers and message body.
member.returns: true if the filter can only access header values; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Routing.Configuration.RoutingExtensionElement.SoapProcessingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether SOAP processing should occur.
member.returns: true if messages should be marshaled; otherwise, false. The default is true.
